arts.ttl: Juric on Roma draw with USG: ‘The players are giving their all, but we can’t seem to secure results’
arts.sum: Roma’s head coach Ivan Juric expressed his feelings following the 1-1 draw against Union Saint-Gilloise in the Europa League, highlighting both the positives and negatives of the match. “There were moments of both good and bad, where we played with little intensity. Today, we cannot be satisfied with our performance,” he stated. Juric acknowledged that the team has been making several individual errors that have cost them dearly, suggesting it might be a mental issue. “It’s disappointing because the players are giving their all, but we can’t seem to secure results. arts.ttl: Europa League | Union SG 1-1 Roma: Match Report
arts.sum: Roma faced another frustrating draw in the Europa League, as a header from Gianluca Mancini was nullified by a significant slip from goalkeeper Mile Svilar, leading to a 1-1 stalemate against Union Saint-Gilloise. This result leaves the Giallorossi in a precarious position, having secured only four points from their last three European matches. The team was already dealing with absences, including Evan Ndicka due to illness and missing Mario Hermoso and Alexis Saelemaekers. Despite these challenges, coach Ivan Juric opted not to give Mats Hummels his first start. arts.ttl: Roma’s Juric: ‘Hummels is out of the starting XI for technical reasons’
arts.sum: Roma manager Ivan Juric addressed the media ahead of his team’s Europa League match against Union Saint-Gilloise, discussing team selection and recent performances. Speaking to Sky Sport, Juric explained his decisions and outlook for the upcoming game. Regarding Paulo Dybala’s availability, Juric stated, “We need to manage Dybala well. He made a great effort in Verona, today we need to win. We need positivity, we must try to win.” The most notable talking point was the exclusion of Mats Hummels from the starting lineup. Juric clarified, “Hummels? It’s a technical choice. arts.ttl: Hummels Finally Set to Make His First Start with Roma
arts.sum: Barring late surprises, Mats Hummels is finally set to make his first start with Roma. Evan N’Dicka is out for the clash with Union St. Gilloise due to an illness. arts.ttl: Europa League | Union SG v Roma: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: Ivan Juric is expected to make significant changes to his Roma lineup for their Europa League match against Union Saint-Gilloise in Belgium. Following a disappointing defeat last weekend and with an important Serie A fixture against Bologna looming on Sunday, the Roma manager is looking to rotate his squad. Top scorer Artem Dovbyk is likely to be rested, with Eldor Shomurodov getting a chance to lead the attack. On the left wing, Stephan El Shaarawy could replace Nicola Zalewski. In midfield, Bryan Cristante and promising youngster Niccolo Pisilli may start in place of Manu Kone and Enzo Le Fee.
